course.subject: COMM
course.course_title: Six Pretty Good Books: Explorations in Social Science

notes.note: This course can be used to fulfill the social science requirement for HD majors and college credit requirements for other majors in Human Ecology.

Priority given to communication majors and minors, CALS seniors, CALS juniors. Fluency in spoken English assumed. Students absent twice during the first week of class are dropped from course roster. Limited to 30 students per class (fall and spring) or 15 students per class (summer). THERE IS NO CENTRALIZED DEPARTMENT WAITLIST. For individual lecture availability, attend the first day of desired classes.

Pre-req: COMM 1101; six college writing credits or junior standing
Pre-req: COMM 1101; six college writing credits or junior standing
Prerequisite: sophomore standing or higher.
Not open to freshman.
Students from all colleges must register for course by completing an Independent Study Form (Available in 334 Kennedy). Forms must be returned to 334 Kennedy.
Not open to freshmen. Prerequisite: college-level writing course.
Prerequisite: junior, senior, or graduate standing; college-level writing course.

course.subject: COMM
course.course_title: Writing and Editing for Magazines and Online Media

notes.note: Junior or Senior standing. COMM 2310 or equivalent. Preference given to COMM majors. Laptop required.
Prerequisite: COMM/INFO 2450. May be taken concurrently with COMM/INFO 2450.
Prerequisites: COMM 2450.
Class is alternate Monday's. Pre- or corequisite: junior or senior standing; present or past undergraduate teaching assistant for COMM course.
Prerequisite: COMM 2820.
Prerequisites: introductory psychology or COMM 1101 or 2200. One evening mid-semester prelim. Enrollment limited to: Juniors and Seniors.
Prerequisites: COMM 2450 or instructor's permission.

Permission of instructor and limited to seniors who major in Sociology, Psychology, Human Development, Communications, ILRLR, and Economics. Capstone seminar for seniors who are interested in graduate study in scientific disciplines that focus on human behavior. Course is designed to mirror the introductory course SOC/HD/COM/ILRLR 1840 Six Pretty Good Books. Seniors are expected to attend both the weekly seminar on Wednesday afternoons (4:30-5:55) and the Wednesday evening lecture (7:30-9:30).

Enrollment limited to: COMM majors or minors (first-, second-, third-, or fourth-year) for 1 credit (minimum 60 hours). May be repeated once for a total of 2 credits. Enroll online: http://cals.cornell.edu/academics/registrar/policies/#independent-study.

Prerequisite: 3.0 GPA. May be repeated up to 6 credits with different supervising faculty member. Students must register using independent study form Available online: http://cals.cornell.edu/academics/registrar/policies/#independent-study.

1-3 credits; may be repeated to 6 credits with different courses. Intended for undergraduates desiring classroom teaching experience. Prerequisite: junior or senior standing; 3.0 GPA (2.7 if teaching assistant for skills development course); permission of faculty member who supervises work and assigns grade. Students must register using independent study form (Available online: http://cals.cornell.edu/academics/registrar/policies/#independent-study).

Prerequisite: 3.0 GPA. Enrollment limited to: seniors. May be repeated to 6 credits. Students must register using independent study form (Available online: http://cals.cornell.edu/academics/registrar/policies/#independent-study).

course.subject: COMM
course.course_title: Independent Honors Research in Social Science
course.class_descr: Ind Honors Res in Soc Science

notes.note: Prerequisite: requirements for honors program. Enrollment limited to: undergraduates. Enrollment preference given to: students pursuing the research honors thesis in Communication. Students must complete the CALS Honors program application by the third week of the fall semester of their senior year. Students should select a faculty advisor and begin proposal development during their junior year. submit an Independent Study Form (Available online: http://cals.cornell.edu/academics/registrar/policies/#independent-study).
Enrollment limited to: graduate students.
Prerequisite: One graduate level research methods course.
Enrollment limited to: communication graduate students or permission of instructor.
Recommended prerequisite: familiarity with basic statistical concepts.
